account.kb.creation-form.anonymization.c: By enabling anonymization, personal information (people names, phone numbers, email addresses, bank account details, credit card number) will be permanently removed from any ingested data and therefore not searchable.
account.kb.creation-form.anonymization.d:
Anonymization ensures that any personal information, such as people names, phone numbers, email addresses, bank account details, or credit card numbers, present in the data you push to your Knowledge Box is automatically identified and removed.
Only apply anonymization for legal reasons (GDPR-compliant services), as it will impact your results and the removed data wonâ€™t be searchable. Read the documentation for more information.
account.kb.creation-form.description: A Knowledge Box is a container that stores and organizes data inside your Nuclia account. Knowledge Boxes represent isolated workspaces (such as projects, teams, or clients) and operate independently with their own access permissions to keep information secured and organized.
account.kb.creation-form.kb-info.descrip: Set the name and description of the Knowledge Box.
account.kb.creation-form.kb-info.title: Knowledge Box information
account.kb.creation-form.title: Create a Knowledge Box
account.kb.creation-form.vector-database:
Nuclia utilizes NucliaDB, an open-source data framework specifically designed for RAG applications. NucliaDB includes its own vector database implementation to efficiently manage your data.
While you have the option to use an external vector database, please note that this may result in certain feature limitations.
Pinecone api keys can be obtained following this documentation
When using Pinecone vector database, some Nuclia features like keyword and full text search wonâ€™t be available.
account.kb-description: A Knowledge Box is a collection of content that Nuclia searches on. Some search engines call it an "index" or "corpus".  In most cases, you only need one Knowledge Box for your application.

Define the personality traits of the assistant, how it should behave when answering questions or during a conversation. For example, you could define that the system will answer as a health professional.
kb.ai-models.answer-generation.prompt.de: Defines the way you want the system to act when you ask a question. Here you can define more specific rules, that could even override the defined behavior. For example, you could set a prompt that makes the system only give results in lists, or even ask to answer in a given language.

kb.ai-models.extraction.config.processin: It converts table contents into MarkDown that can be used by a LLM.
Maximum amount of pages to merge
When merging too much pages in order to extract split tables, you might reach the LLM output token limit.
Merge tables split over several pages

Please keep in mind that the use of this feature carries Nuclia token consumption.
  • It is only advised for documents with complex tables that are hard to read, have no visual delineations, or are split across several pages.
  • Itâ€™s not needed for CSVs nor Excel files.
You can provide additional rules to the visual LLM:
Useful for non-standard page layouts, or complex tables. It can alse improve extraction for scanned pages.
Please keep in mind that the use of this feature carries Nuclia token consumption.

search.configuration.action.get-code-too: Make a search to view the API request details
search.configuration.action.rag-lab-tool: Compare the answer generated from your different search configurations
search.configuration.action.switch-mode: Switch to direct JSON edit mode. The JSON edit mode allows using advanced features of the API but disables some of UI-related options of the widget.
search.configuration.action.switch-mode-: Once switched to JSON mode, you cannot switch back to regular mode.
search.configuration.delete-config-confi: This action cannot be undone. Deleting the configuration will delete its record in the saved configuration dropdown.
search.configuration.generative-answer.a: A slug contains only alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

The generative answer will use the entire text of this specific resource as context instead of the search results matching the query. Note: if the resource text content is too long, it might be shortened when passed to the LLM.
search.configuration.generative-answer.g: Generate a response to the userâ€™s questions and allow to chat with the system. If you deselect this toggle the user will only get keywords and vector search results.
Use a different generative model than the default one defined in the Knowledge Box AI settings
search.configuration.generative-answer.i: Let users append images to their textual question.
search.configuration.generative-answer.l: Defines the maximum number of tokens that the model will read and/or generate. A low number may prevent your users to see results.
search.configuration.generative-answer.p: Generate the answer using markdown format
It will take precedence over the user prompt defined in the Knowledge Box settings. Note: the prompt strategy might change depending on the generative model.
search.configuration.generative-answer.r: Limit the amount of messages passed in the context (default 15)
Choose which parts of the conversations to include as context
Exclude resources matching a given filter
Include the remaining text blocks after the maximum number of resources has been reached
Limit the amount of full resources that will be passed to the LLM
Passes entire resource as context when generating answers (instead of just the paragraphs retrieved by the search query). Note: this strategy can be expensive and/or can impact performances.
If enabled, only relationships extracted from a graph extraction agent are considered for context expansion.

After regular reranking, use a generative model to rank relationships.
It is slower and consumes more tokens, but can provide better results.

Number of hops to take when exploring the graph for relevant context.
For example, hops=1 will explore the neighbors of the starting entities, hops=2 will explore the neighbors of the neighbors of the starting entities, and so on.
Bigger values will discover more intricate relationships but will also take more time to compute.

If enabled, the text of the relationships is used as context instead of paragraphs, this enables to use bigger top K values without running into the generative model's context limits. If disabled, the paragraphs that contain the relationships are used as context.

Uses fuzzy search to detect entities. It's faster and more flexible but might have trouble matching entities composed of multiple words (it will fallback to default detection if no entities are detected). The default detection is slower and more accurate but requires an exact text match between Knowledge Box entities and entities in the query.
Collect context pieces by exploring the Knowledge Graph, starting from the NERs present in the query. It works best if the Knowledge Box has a user-defined Graph Extraction agent enabled.
Maximum amount of relevant relationships to use
Requires using OpenAI ChatGPT-Vision or Google Gemini Pro Vision.
Each paragraph will be followed by different sets of metadata.
For each paragraph, additional adjacent paragraphs are provided as context.
Limit the quantity of page screenshots passed in the context
To benefit from the visual LLM abilities, the matching pages will be passed as screenshots in the context.
Images extracted from the matching paragraphs will be added to the context.
One field id per line. The field ids have to be in the format {field_type}/{field_name}, like 'a/title', 'a/summary' for title and summary fields or 't/amend' for a text field named â€™amendâ€™.
Passes specific fields (designated by their ids) along with the paragraphs retrieved by the search query
Each paragraph will be preceded by the title of the resource and its summary (if defined).
search.configuration.generative-answer.s: It will take precedence over the system prompt defined in the Knowledge Box settings. Note: the prompt strategy might change depending on the generative model.
search.configuration.json-config-error: The search configuration is an invalid JSON string.
search.configuration.loading-error: An error occurred while loading search configurations
search.configuration.modification-warnin: The current configuration is different from the selected one, click save to save a new configuration.
search.configuration.result-display.cita: Specifies the minimum similarity score required to assign a citation to the generated answer. Note: high threshold may result in no citations being shown, and low threshold may result in improper citations.
search.configuration.result-display.disp: Display a section listing all the fields of the resource in the right sidebar of the viewer. This section is only visible for resources containing multiple fields.

Metadata can belong to the following kinds: 'origin', 'field', or 'extra'. Their type can be either 'string', 'date', or 'list'. Use the following syntax: "kind:path:type", example: "field:file.md5:string". One value per line.
Metadata are displayed under the title of each resource.
Show all results from the search
Paragraphs used to generate the answer
Search results are displayed under the answer.
Thumbnails are a preview of the resource.
search.configuration.result-display.hide: Hide the generated answer. Only useful when the user cares about the citations but not about the answer itself.
search.configuration.result-display.json: For maximal accuracy, please include a description for each field of the schema.
You provide a JSON schema describing the structure of the answer youâ€™ll get.
JSON output is not available for the generative model {{ model }}.
search.configuration.result-display.rela: Displays information about NERs in the search results. Cannot be used with the "Match synonyms" option.
Shows all the relations between entities for a given resource in the viewer.
search.configuration.result-display.sect: Choose what to show in the results.
search.configuration.result-display.show: Show images associated with the paragraphs retrieved in the results.
search.configuration.result-display.sort: The user will be able to define the order of the search results.
Please save or reset the search configuration before creating a widget.
search.configuration.save-config-modal.d: Give a name to your search configuration to find it again.
search.configuration.save-error: An error occurred while saving the search configurations
search.configuration.search-box.automati: Detects entities mentioned in the user query and turns them automatically into filters.
search.configuration.search-box.filter-l: Return results that match all of the selected filters
Return results that match at least one of the selected filters
Note that OR logic is not applied to creation date filter
Filtering will be based on the origin.created value if provided in the resource, otherwise it will default to the resource creation date (created).
Please note: all resources created before 2023-11-02 will have to be reprocessed for origin.created to be filterable.
The user will be able to apply filters to the search.
search.configuration.search-box.limit-pa: To control how many of the most relevant paragraphs are passed to the LLM to generate the answer. Default: 20.
search.configuration.search-box.preselec: Equivalent to the NOT(a OR b) logical expression
Equivalent to the NOT(a AND b) logical expression
Path of the resource in the source system
Tags defined in the resourceâ€™s "origin" property
One expression from the preselected filtersâ€™ input is malformed
{{count}} expressions from the preselected filtersâ€™ input are malformed
Filter format documented here. These filters will be applied to any search queries without being visible to the end users.
Define filters that will be applied by default to any query.
search.configuration.search-box.querypre: This text will be inserted before the userâ€™s query. It allows to define a specific context, so the search results are accurate even though the user is not specifiying what they are asking about.
search.configuration.search-box.rephrase: Rephrase the query in order to obtain better semantic search results. (Note: the query is unchanged regarding keyword search)
This prompt will be used to rephrase the user query to optimize search results. Note: the original user query will be preserve when passing it to the LLM to obtain an answer.
search.configuration.search-box.rrf-boos: Boosting factor for semantic results compare to keyword results
Will merge the semantic and keyword results with the Reciprocal Rank Fusion algorithm. Optionally, you can boost the semantic results compare to the keyword results.
search.configuration.search-box.select-r: Select which results are used to generate the answer
search.configuration.search-box.semantic: Use a different embeddings model than the default one defined in the Knowledge Box AI settings

Initially retrieve a larger amount of semantic and keyword search results and then filter them down to the most contextually accurate matches using a re-ranking model. The result is a more accurate and better ordered list of results.
search.configuration.search-box.show-hid: Hidden resources will not be excluded from search and answer generation.
search.configuration.search-box.suggesti: Suggest NERs to autocompleting the search query
Theyâ€™ll be visible under the search box.
search.configuration.search-box.synonyms: Match synonyms in fuzzy search. This feature cannot be used with the "Relations" option.
search.configuration.search-box.use-sear: If disabled, the search results will not be used to generate the answer. The LLM will generate responses based solely on its own knowledge base.
search.configuration.search-request-moda: If the Knowledge Box is private, authentication headers need to be provided.
search.configuration.unsupported-info: This search configuration is using API options not covered by the basic search widget features.

tasks-automation.type.prompt-guard.descr: This agent flags resources or paragraphs containing sentences that could jail break the LLM prompt. Flagging is done using a label set named "jailbreak_safety".
tasks-automation.type.prompt-guard.title: LLM security
tasks-automation.type.synthetic-question: Enrich your resources by automatically adding questions & answers to them.
test-page.title: Testing page
upload.advanced.extraction.empty: To customize data extraction, please create an extract configuration on
upload.advanced.extraction.title: Customize data extraction
upload.advanced.extraction.warning: Please keep in mind that the use of this configuration carries Nuclia token consumption.
upload.advanced.language-detection.check: Let Nuclia automatically detect the language
upload.advanced.language-detection.input: Use specified language when processing the files uploaded
upload.advanced.processing.aitable.help: It converts table contents into MarkDown that can be used by a LLM.
upload.advanced.processing.aitable.label: Interpret tables
upload.advanced.processing.aitable.warni:
Please keep in mind that the use of this feature carries Nuclia token consumption.
  • It is only advised for documents with complex tables that are hard to read, have no visual delineations, or are split across several pages.
  • Itâ€™s not needed for CSVs nor Excel files.
upload.advanced.processing.blankline.hel: Will split text blocks according blank lines. Note: it only applies to .txt files.
upload.advanced.processing.help: Nature-specific processing is longer and generate more costs than regular processing.
upload.advanced.processing.invoice.label: Process invoices
upload.advanced.processing.none.label: None
upload.advanced.processing.table.help: It extracts tables as images so they can be processed by a visual LLM.
upload.advanced.processing.table.label: Extract tables
upload.advanced.processing.title: Specific processings
upload.advanced.processing.visual-llm.he: Useful for non-standard page layouts, or complex tables.
upload.advanced.processing.visual-llm.wa: Please keep in mind that the use of this feature carries Nuclia token consumption.
upload.advanced.title: Options
upload.csv_css_selector: CSS selector column is mandatory, but you can keep it empty if you donâ€™t need it.
upload.csv_description: Create multiple resources by selecting a CSV file with 4 columns: Title, Body, Format, Labels
upload.csv_format: Format column must be one of these values: PLAIN / MARKDOWN / KEEP_MARKDOWN /HTML / RST
upload.csv_links_description: Select a CSV file with 3 columns: Url, Labels, CSS selector
upload.invalid-csv-labels: Invalid CSV: the format of the Labels column is incorrect.
upload.invalid-sitemap: The selected sitemap is not valid
upload.invalid_csv: Invalid CSV: please ensure each row has exactly {{num}} columns.
upload.invalid_image: Selected file is not a valid image
upload.limit-exceeded: Too many uploads. Try again in a moment.
upload.limit-warning: Your account is processing over {{limit}} resources simultaneously, which may lead to errors or limitations. Please wait for the queue to decrease or upload at a slower rate.
upload.once_uploaded: Once uploaded, you can see the status of your files in the Pending resources page. When the files are processed, they will show up in the Resources list.
upload.qna_csv_description: Create a Q&A resource by selecting a CSV file with 2 columns: Question, Answer
upload.qna_csv_preview.question: Question
upload.select_file: Drop your file(s) or click here
upload.sitemap.parameters-help: Nuclia will send these parameters when retrieving the content of the URLs. You can use them to provide authentication.
upload.sitemap.title: Upload sitemap
upload.takes_time: We need some time to process the files. Feel free to close this dialog box and keep working.
upload.toast.blocked: Your upload quota has been reached, you need to upgrade your account.
upload.toast.limit: Your account has been issuing too many requests over a short period. Try again in a moment.
upload.uploading_files: Uploading files. Feel free to use Nuclia in the meantime
upload.use_folder_as_labels.help: First-level folder is the label set name, subfolders are labels. If subfolders are nested, files will get multiple labels. Labels will be created automatically if they are not defined in the Knowledge Box yet.
upload.use_folder_as_labels.label: Use folder names as label names
upload.warning.size-limit.description: Files exceeding those sizes will not be uploaded
upload.warning.size-limit.limit-details: Media files can not exceed {{ maxMedia }} and non-media files {{ max }}.
upload.warning.size-limit.title: Size limits exceeded
upload.warning-archive-description:
Archive files (like .zip, .tar, etc.) are supported, but take note that all the files contained in an archive will be gathered in a single resource.

If you expect to get separated results when searching, it is better to extract the files and upload them as separate files.
upload.warning-archive-title: You are about to upload {{num}} archive files
upload.warning-spreadsheet-title: You are about to upload {{num}} spreadsheet files
upload.warning-spreadsheets-description: The embeddings indexing of these files might not be optimal depending on their format and structure. See the documentation for more information.
welcome.reader: You were invited to {{title}} Knowledge Box as a Reader; you can consult resources and perform search operations.
welcome.start: Where would you like to start?
welcome.title: Welcome, {{name}}!
welcome.writer: You were invited to {{title}} Knowledge Box as a Writer; you can upload and consult resources, and perform search operations.
